job_title: IT Support Specialist in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Manager very works as a team.
cons: Covered many area on campus. A golf cart was need it.

pros: You do work weekends, good insurance
cons: Dirty facility, always short-staffed, they hire anyone as a tech, expensive insurance, not much pto

pros: the hours were flexible and the ability to pick up shifts as needed.
cons: the supervisors could have been more supportive.

pros:
Overtime always available
Good way to get experience in mental health
Free parking in a good area of Philly
Tuition reimbursement
Some of the coworkers are really great/fun to work with
cons:
Lack of communication and support all around.
Forced to work through breaks and very short staffed which causes burnout quick. 
Unsafe work environment because of how short staffed each unit is and lack of security. Having only 2 techs on CD that is four floors and houses over 60 patients should be illegal. 
There is no accountability for staff or patients.
Some of the staff will curse at and belittle the patients. They will start arguments and fights with the patients constantly or hide out in the breakroom for hours and nothing gets done about it. The staff that do care are abused and berated on a daily basis by the patients. There is 0 accountability or support from management.

review_title: Not the best place to work, but certainly not the worst
pros:
Unit teams work together well
Great resume builder, learn a lot
cons:
Poor management
Micro-managed
Poor pay for a for-profit company
Excessive turnover, nothing done to retain good employees

pros: Psych services team, medical staff
cons: Leadership turnover, front line staff turnover

review_title: Zero stars if  could. DON'T WORK HERE. It's straight up illegal here.
pros: Some of the staff here work very hard and are very friendly. Lots of goodies at orientation.
cons: No breaks or lunches on almost all shifts. About half the staff that should be on a floor. Dangerous patients who are actively trying to leave. Management that will not respect you as an employee or the rights you have in the city of Philadelphia and state of Pennsylvania as an employee. Very low pay for the work. Very anti-union. Assume that if you work here, you won't be able to do it for more than a few months before a better opportunity comes your way, this place is awful.

pros: Good environment to work in
cons: Extremely underpaid- especially for those who have a four year degree

pros: Great Human Resources department to have
cons: Non applicable, start in September

pros: Good for bonuses and PRN staff
cons: Outdated facility, low starting rate, ratchet

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Great teamwork between Nurses and Psych Techs
cons: Need better support from management

review_title: There is a lot of favoritism at the roxborough location! If you sleep with the staff, they’ll do favors for you!
pros: It’s a beautiful campus! Located in beautiful roxborough area. It’scovient to septa bus routes. It’s pretty easy to get to.
cons: They have to many people having relationships with each other there. They are a behavioral health facility, that are hands free, put cameras everywhere! When patients are discharged, the rooms are not cleaned the way I would want to be cleaned if I had to lay in the bed. The beds are bolted to the floors, and some of the patients live there for up to a year, in my 10 years there they moved 5 beds outta 33 of them due to an ant problem, it was disgusting the filth under those beds!!

job_title: Part Time RN in Phila, PA
pros: Great pay and other nurses could be helpful.
cons: Unsafe environment. Never properly staffed, patients verbally abused staff and restraints were used on a nightly basis. When changes occurred within the company nurses were not informed until on the floor with patients. Overall an unsafe environment for nurses and patients.

review_title: Forget patient care keep those beds full
pros: health benefits, tuition reimbursement, lots of over time offered. fun co-workers, free parking, flexible schedules, located in a safer area of the city.
cons: sometimes it seems there is a lack of patient care.  Corporate cares more about keeping the beds full as opposed to whats safe for the patients and staff. frequently short staffed. a thankless environment

pros: Lots of overtime..... that is only benefit
cons: Poor management and Administration, low pay rate, no holiday pay,  management care less about their staff, easily got hurt during holds if not careful

review_title: Not the best place to work, but not the worst either.
pros: A lot of OT,  understanding of your outside commitments, room for growth.  Flexibility in work schedules. Training opportunities
cons: Some favoritism, cliques among staff, poor communication, variation of rules across units.

review_title: Great place to work with staff that work as a team
pros: Management is willing to work with you and there is room for advvancement.
cons: The location is located in an area that has hills and is hard to manage in the winter

review_title: Not very good and no support system,poor protection froform patient in withdrawal
pros: One star cause I had to put a star, really poor management and support from management,always afraid of doing something wrong ,even trained
cons:
Poor pay,micro management,management had really big skills ,never stated by the staff ,only a few doctors cared - sign papers and sign your life away as long as your insurance pays if not patient let go and not helped
,sad

pros: Clinical experience gained that’s all
cons:
No support 
Heavy caseload 
Ignorant upper management

pros: Overtime & meeting interesting patients
cons: Management was horrible! The facility is poorly ran, adolescent unit is a joke! No advancement.
